author: Sports Gaga Partner
content: In the highly anticipated fifth Test between England and India, England won the toss and chose to bat. This match holds special significance as Ravichandran Ashwin and Jonny Bairstow play their 100th Test. Rahul Dravid honored Ashwin with a special cap, while Rohit Sharma embraced and congratulated him, showcasing the spirit of sportsmanship.
title: Dravid honors Ashwin with a special cap on the landmark 100th test

author: Jatin Kandelwal
content: Senior India off-spinner R Ashwin received a guard of honor from the Indian players before the start of play in Dharamsala in the fifth Test against England. This is Ashwin's 100th Test match, and he became only the 14th Indian to reach this milestone game. He was given a commemorative cap from coach Dravid.
title: R Ashwin gets a guard of honor from Indian players; video

author: Anmol Sharma
content: Team India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin posed with his wife Prithi and daughters after receiving special cap for his 100th Test from Team India head coach Rahul Dravid. The ongoing Dharamshala Test between India and England is Ashwin's 100th Test match. Ashwin is the 14th Indian cricketer to play 100 Test matches.
title: Ashwin poses with wife, daughters after receiving special cap for 100th Test

author: Naman Agarwal
content: England have listed coaching staff members Paul Collingwood and Marcus Trescothick as sub-fielders for the Dharamshala Test after Ollie Robinson was unable to travel to the ground with illness. ICC playing conditions stipulate that sides must name a maximum of four substitute fielders for a Test match.
title: ENG list Collingwood, Trescothick as sub-fielders in Dharamshala

author: Sports Gaga Partner
content: India's KL Rahul, wicketkeeper-batter, shared gym training photos on Instagram from National Cricket Academy, Bengaluru. Captioned with a simple "Hi", hinting at injury recovery post-first Test against England in Hyderabad. Eager for IPL 2024, he aims to shine for Lucknow Super Giants, slated for the opening match on March 24.
title: KL Rahul shares glimpse of recovery journey with fans ahead of IPL

author: Abhishek
content: Ahead of the fifth Test between India and England, Indian batter Rajat Patidar missed out of the playing XI which saw Karnataka batter Devdutt Paddikal make his Test debut. Speaking at the toss, Rohit Sharma confirmed Patidar's absence. He revealed the Royal Challengers Bangalore star got injured on the eve of the final Test and was replaced by Devdutt Paddikal.
title: Why is Rajat Patidar not playing 5th Test against England?

author: ReferSMS Partner
content: At the ISPL T10 inauguration, Sachin Tendulkar and Elvish Yadav added glamour with their presence, blending cricket and comedy. The event, held at Thane's Dadaji Kondadev Stadium, saw stars like Akshay and Ram Charan joining in the festivities. Munawar, winner of "Big Boss 17," and Elvish, winner of "Big Boss OTT 2," also graced the occasion, sparking excitement among fans.
title: Sachin Tendulkar & Elvish add star power to ISPL kickoff ceremony

author: Sports Gaga Partner
content: Sachin's heartwarming gesture touched fans as he invited Kashmir para-cricketer Amir Hussain and his family to the ISPL T10 2024 opening ceremony. Tendulkar, who previously gifted Lone a signed bat during his Kashmir visit, not only invited him but also batted alongside him in a celebrity match. Fans flooded social media with emotions as images of their partnership went viral.
title: Cricket unites: Tendulkar & Amir Hussain shine at ISPL T10 opener

author: FPJ Online Edit
content: In a video that has gone viral on social media, Ravichandran Ashwin was given a guard of honour by his teammates as he took the field for his 100th Test on day 1 in Dharamsala. Head coach Rahul Dravid felicitated Ashwin with his 100th cap, with the latter's wife and child also present at the venue.
title: Video: R Ashwin gets guard of honour on day 1 in Dharamsala

author: Naman Agarwal
content: Pakistan quick Naseem Shah, who returned after a five-month injury layoff, said that the culture in his country does not allow the players to opt for voluntary rest. "If a newcomer performs in one game, the main bowlers are afraid of their place in the XI...sometimes when you rest, your career can end up resting in peace," he said.
title: Naseem Shah says Pakistan players fear asking for rest
